Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    The Level Class will hold any and all information for a Level being played in the game.
    Creation Date: 20/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 8/12/19.
    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    Timothy Roger (977422), Nihal Goindi (976005)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(Character chara,
             int[] dim,
             Cell[][] map,
             Enemy[] enem,
             int prevTime,
             int deathCount)
        Constructs a Level instance ready to be played.
        Parameters:
        chara - Character - the instance of Character to be referenced by the Level object.
        dim - int[] - the dimensions of the two-dimensional array, map.
        map - Cell[][] - holds all instances of Cell that make up the map in a grid-like form.
        enem - Enemy[] - the array of Enemy instances that are on the level.
        prevTime - int - the total time spent during the previous load of the level.
        deathCount - int - the amount of deaths from the previous load of the level.

    • Method Detail

      • runTurn

        public void runTurn(java.lang.String direction)
        Runs a whole turn of the level based on the passed direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - String - indicates the direction in which the character is to try and move.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        Draws the current state of the level to the canvas for the palyer to see.
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - The path to get to the folder where the images that need to be used are.
        canvas - Canvas - the canvas upon which everything must be drawn.

      • winCheck

        public boolean winCheck()
        Checks if the level has been won. Will be true once the character has reached a goal tile.
        Returns:
        a boolean value based on result of the check.

      • restartCheck

        public boolean restartCheck()
        Checks if the level needs to be restarted. This is true if the level's referenced character is dead.
        Returns:
        a boolean value based on result of the check.

      • setLevelID

        public void setLevelID(int lvlID)
        Sets the levelID of the level to a new value.
        Parameters:
        lvlID - int - the new value of levelID.

      • getLevelID

        public int getLevelID()
        Gets the levelID value of the Level instance.
        Returns:
        the int value of levelID.

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int[] c)
        Retrieves the Cell instance at a certain position in the map.
        Parameters:
        c - int[] - The coordinates of the Cell to return.
        Returns:
        the found Cell instance.

      • getDimensions

        public int[] getDimensions()
        Gets the dimensions of the level.
        Returns:
        the small int array containing the width and length of the map.

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()
        Gets the character the level is referencing.
        Returns:
        the Character instance being used.

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        Works out and returns the cumulative play time of the level.
        Returns:
        the cumulative time the player has spent alive.

      • getDeaths

        public int getDeaths()
        Retrieves the current death count of the level instance.
        Returns:
        the integer value of the death count.

      • setDeaths

        public void setDeaths(int d)
        Sets the number of deaths in the level instance to the passed value.
        Parameters:
        d - int - the value to set the death count to.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Get the player's score for the level which they have completed.
        Returns:
        the integer value of score.

      • getEnemies

        public Enemy[] getEnemies()
        Gets the array of enemies on the level.
        Returns:
        the array of Enemy instances being used in the level.

      • outOfBoundsCheck

        private boolean outOfBoundsCheck(int[] c)
        Checks if the passed coordinates are outside the dimensional bounds of the map.
        Parameters:
        c - int[] - The coordinates to be checked.
        Returns:
        the response as a boolean variable.

      • getNewCharacterCoords

        private int[] getNewCharacterCoords(java.lang.String direction)
        Finds the map coordinates of where the character will want to move to based on passed direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - String - Signifies direction of movement on the map. Should be one of the four directions of a compass. Anything else wont change the characte's current coordinates.
        Returns:
        The wanted character coordinates.

      • validMove

        private boolean validMove(int[] c)
        Returns a boolean value based on the combined results on checks for the validity of the character's move attempt.
        Parameters:
        c - int[] - The coordinates to be checked.
        Returns:
        the response as a boolean value.
